H0.text: Electrical to heat is the energy conversion that occurs in a household toaster.

H1.text: Heat to chemical is the energy conversion that occurs in a household toaster, converting electrical energy into heat that changes the chemical structure of the toasted bread.

H2.text: Electrical to chemical is the energy conversion that occurs in a household toaster.

H3.text: Heat to mechanical is the energy conversion performed by a household toaster.

A4.text: A toaster is a small electric appliance that uses radiant heat to cook sliced bread into toast.

A5.text: When cooked the bread browns due to the maillard reaction.

A6.text: Electric heating is a process in which electrical energy is converted directly to heat energy.

A7.text: The heating element inside every electric heater is an electrical resistor, and works on the principle of Joule heating: an electric current passing through a resistor will convert that electrical energy into heat energy.
